function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Potential transmission of diseases in the built environment due to close proximity and shared spaces.","Impact":"Increased risk of disease spread and outbreaks, leading to potential health crisis and economic impact.","Mitigation":"Implementation of safety distance markers, hands-free door opening, use of disinfectants, and material replacement to reduce virus residence time.","Technologies":"Thermal sensors, touch-free digital and IT solutions, new HVAC systems, and selective solid waste collection and treatment.","People":"Building occupants, visitors, and the general public.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, and urban planners."},{"Description":"Temporary or intermittent measures that mitigate the risk of transmission without bringing long-term sustainability benefits.","Impact":"Limited effectiveness in addressing broader sustainability goals, leading to potential trade-offs in risk mitigation.","Mitigation":"Integration of incremental, factorial, and disruptive measures that leverage sustainability aspects in addition to addressing disease transmission risks.","Technologies":"Incremental measures like thermal sensors, touch-free solutions, and new HVAC systems; factorial measures like minimalist design, natural ventilation, and local energy supply; disruptive measures like zero-energy buildings and green urban areas.","People":"Building occupants, visitors, and the general public.","Owner":"Building owners, urban planners, and sustainability experts."},{"Description":"Risk of poor air quality and ventilation contributing to the spread of diseases, including COVID-19, in non-residential buildings.","Impact":"Increased likelihood of disease transmission due to inadequate ventilation, leading to potential health and economic consequences.","Mitigation":"Implementation of new HVAC systems with increased ventilation, humidity control, and filtration, along with natural ventilation and open access to sunlight.","Technologies":"New HVAC systems with increased ventilation and humidity control, touch-free and digital solutions for building access, and selective solid waste collection and treatment.","People":"Occupants of non-residential buildings, visitors, and the general public.","Owner":"Building owners, facility managers, and urban planners."}]}
